xml.brief: Get the list of all public OKAPI installations
xml.desc: Get the list of all public OKAPI installations. Keep in mind that OKAPI installations might differ slightly. If you plan on using multiple OKAPI installations in your application (which is a very good thing!) you should test it against the one with the lowest OKAPI version number.

returns.p: A dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: site_name - universal name for this site (should be fine for all languages),

site_url - URL of the Opencaching site which is running the OKAPI installation (usually this looks like "http://www.opencaching.xx/", where xx is a top level domain of a country). If you prefer either http or https access, evaluate https to find out if the desired scheme is available, and eventually replace the scheme in the site_url string.

okapi_base_url - URL of the OKAPI installation (usually this is site_url with "okapi/" appended, but you should not assume that); this value is to be used as a prefix when constructing service method URLs. If you prefer either http oder https access, evaluate https to find out if the desired scheme is available, and eventually replace the scheme in the okapi_base_url string.

https - https support of the Opencaching site and the OKAPI installation; one of the following:
unavailable - https will not work (properly) or will be redirected to http,
availaible - http and https will both work,
recommended - http and https will both work, but http is deprecated; if your application allows it, use https,
enforced - http will be redirected to https.
